summary: This document is a chain of emails from August 2019 between attorneys from the law firm Akin Gump Strauss Hauer & Feld and federal prosecutors (likely from the SDNY) regarding scheduling a proffer session. The proffer is to provide an overview of Jeffrey Epstein's relationship with a bank, his accounts, and notable transactions as part of an internal investigation and in response to a subpoena.

persons.name: Parvin Moyne
persons.role: Attorney at Akin Gump Strauss Hauer & Feld
persons.context: Primary correspondent proposing and organizing a proffer session for federal prosecutors to explain Epstein's banking relationships and transactions.

persons.name: Thomas Moyer
persons.context: Copied on all email correspondence regarding the scheduling and format of the proffer session related to Epstein's financial records.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central subject of the financial investigation; the proffer aims to detail his relationship with a bank and transactions in his accounts.

connections.description: Both are attorneys copied on the same email chain coordinating a legal proffer, indicating they are working together on the matter.
Moyne's firm (Akin Gump) is conducting an internal investigation and preparing a proffer regarding Epstein's banking relationships, suggesting a legal or investigative representation.

events.title: Production Index Provided
events.description: Parvin Moyne sends an index of document productions related to the Epstein investigation to federal prosecutors.

events.title: Proffer Session Scheduling
events.description: Extended email negotiation to schedule a 2-3 hour attorney proffer session to overview Epstein's bank relationships and transactions for SDNY prosecutors.

locations: One Bryant Park, New York, NY 10036-6745 (Akin Gump office)
keyFacts: Attorneys from Akin Gump Strauss Hauer & Feld were engaged in an internal investigation of Jeffrey Epstein's relationship with a bank and his financial transactions.
The law firm was producing documents and preparing a detailed proffer for federal prosecutors (SDNY) to guide them through the financial records.
The proffer was intended to highlight 'various transactions that we have noted in our internal investigation' related to Epstein's accounts.
The email chain shows active coordination between Epstein's legal representatives and federal authorities in August-September 2019, shortly after Epstein's arrest.
